monster_entry.name: Abhoth, Spawn of
monster_entry.subtitle: Slimy Progeny
monster_entry.description: Curious things of a mainly pale hue comprised white, gray, and yellow flesh, sticky and slime-coated. Each is born of Abhoth and takes a unique form, often bizarre and strange. Some appearing with multiple appendages or legs or arms, others with more than one mouth-like maw, and some with many eyes or sensory organs.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Abhoth's spawn are numerous and take many forms, each birthed from the Outer God's bulk, and each one unique in form and appearance. They are complex life forms, although some do not appear to be "finished," with vestigial limbs and half-formed bodies, while others seem fully realized. Variously, they range in looks from juvenile prehistoric creatures and monstrous mutants to bothersome-looking humanoids and amorphous globs of living flesh. Some can walk or fly, while many simply crawl or glide slug-like.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Every spawn is different, each has a different mode of attack.

attacks.name: Crush (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Envelops the target and then crushes on the following round. The target may attempt to break free on their action with a successful opposed STR or DEX roll.

armor.modifiers: Regenerates 1D6 hit points per round (death at zero hit points).

monster_entry.name: Adherent of the Unpeakable Oath
monster_entry.subtitle: Servants of Hastur
monster_entry.description: These foul caricatures of humanity have given over their will completely to Him Who Is Not To Be Named. Their lumpen flesh has turned scaly and mottled green-gray, their jelly-like arms and legs shamble and wobble as though boneless, and their faces are mask-like, with deep-set eyes hardly visible.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: The adherents are creatures who have accepted Hastur's Unspeakable Oath and been transformed into something other. While on earth such creatures tend to be of human origin, other species are lured by the Unspeakable Promise and so the adherents may come in many strange forms. Once the Oath is recited, Hastur's will is imposed upon the adherent, changing their physical form into to jelly-like substance, able to walk and squeeze itself through narrow places.

powers_and_abilities.name: Nightly Feeding
powers_and_abilities.description: Each night an adherent must feed, grasping its victim with its tentacular arms with a successful attack. The target is held and on the following round is drained of bodily fluids at the rate of 1D10 damage per round until death or the target breaks away. Any damage caused is consumed by the adherent, increasing its STR and SIZ by an amount equal to the damage multiplied by 5.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Uses jelly-like arms to strike or grab and then crush opponents.

attacks.name: Grab (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Grabs the target and then crushes/drains on the following round. Target may attempt to break free on their action with a successful opposed STR or DEX roll.

skills.name: Retains those it had while human

monster_entry.spells: Any known before the transformation into an adherent, plus those granted by Hastur.

monster_entry.name: Ashen One
monster_entry.subtitle: Dust Devils
monster_entry.description: Living dust from the ground bones of corpses, some take the form of humanoid nightmares, with faces of dire anger and hatred, while others are akin to those from beyond the stars. Although composed of bone dust, their physicality is solid enough, able to smash and render those who cross their path.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Ashen ones are magical creations, be they forged by a wizard's spell or the thought of a Mythos deity. Rumor holds that a secret spell, said to be hidden in the pages of the Necronomicon, provides the ritual to bring life to the ground down bones of the once-living. Once created, an ashen one is bound to service, although if their mortal creator dies, they are free to roam and devise havoc.

powers_and_abilities.name: Whirling Dust
powers_and_abilities.description: An ashen one may forgo its physical form to transform into a vortex of whirling dust. Takes one round. All within 5 yards/meters suffer 2D4 automatic damage (unless 2+ armor or successful Dodge). Dodge forfeits next action.

powers_and_abilities.name: Possessing Dust
powers_and_abilities.description: May disperse its form to possess a target, entering mouth, nose, and ears. Takes 1D2 rounds. Must win opposed POW roll. If successful, the target is controlled by the ashen one.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Flesh is scored and raked in addition to force of attack.

armor.modifiers: All impaling weapons (incl. bullets) cause minimum damage.

monster_entry.spells: Only those granted by a controlling wizard or god.
monster_entry.sanity_loss: 0/1D4 to encounter physical form; no loss if encountering in whirling dust form.

monster_entry.name: Atlach-Nacha, Daughter of
monster_entry.subtitle: Hideous Spiders
monster_entry.description: The newborn were wet and slimy things, long and spindly legs radiating out from a central mass. Quickly maturing, these spider-like horrors are enormous. Their skin hardens to a deep black color, except for their abdomens, which are streaked with green and yellow. While akin to the spiders of earth, these are of another scale entirely. Limbs and body pulsate with a horrible rhythm. Each leg terminates in a sharp-pointed end, capable of piercing flesh and bone, while their head boasts a hideous, claw-like mandible for feasting on unspeakable delights.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Atlach-Nacha's daughters are enormous, venomous spider-like entities. Chosen by the Great Old One as worthy to serve, a human (or possibly another species) is "rebirthed" by Atlach-Nacha-the process transforming the worshipper into one of its children, known as "daughters." Human devotees who bear the mark of a venomous spider bite are particularly revered by the god's cult priestesses, who regard the subject as "favored."

powers_and_abilities.name: Spin Web
powers_and_abilities.description: Capable of spinning webs to form traps. Unaware characters may fall foul of such traps (STR 70 to break free). Can be cut or burned (1D6 damage per round).

powers_and_abilities.name: Feast
powers_and_abilities.description: Once paralyzed by a bite attack, it may begin to devour the flesh of the victim's head, sucking out the brain. Takes 1 round per 5 INT of the victim. Victim dies at zero INT. Survivors are permanently blind and lose 2D10 APP and the devoured INT.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Uses long spear-like leg to pierce.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.special_effect: Venom is a paralyzing toxin; if target fails Extreme CON roll, they are paralyzed for 1D6 hours.

monster_entry.spells: All know Contact and Call Atlach-Nacha. INT 75+ know 1D3 additional spells.
monster_entry.sanity_loss: 1/1D8. Seeing the process of human transformation costs 1/1D8.

monster_entry.name: Blighted One
monster_entry.subtitle: Alien Parasites
monster_entry.description: Fungus not of this earth. It spreads rapidly, multiplying as it feasts upon anything it encounters... Inhalation leads to a conjoining of flesh and fungi, a bothersome union producing the blighted one, a walking assemblage of fungal blooms, strands, and spores.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Brought to earth by the mi-go, this parasitic fungus devours earthly matter, establishing itself and spreading outward to overgrow an area. The spores are best avoided as inhalation may cause a human or animal to succumb to infection. The spores act parasitically, attaching themselves and multiplying, a process that alters the DNA of the host, mutating them into a blighted one, a mindless walking fungus, driven to infect others.

powers_and_abilities.name: Infection
powers_and_abilities.description: Inhaling spores requires a CON roll (Hard if close). Failure leads to infection. Mutation takes 1D6+1 days. INT rolls required as mind decays; after 72 hours, the host is fully transformed.

powers_and_abilities.name: Spore Kiss
powers_and_abilities.description: Clamps mouth over target's mouth, exhaling spores directly. Victim must succeed in a Hard CON roll to avoid infection.

armor.modifiers: Firearms and impaling weapons inflict minimal damage; fire and toxic chemical-based attacks inflict 1D6 per round damage.

monster_entry.sanity_loss: 1/1D6 to encounter; 1D4/1D6+2 if watching a friend transform.

monster_entry.name: Byakhee
monster_entry.subtitle: Star-Steeds
monster_entry.description: Sometimes singularly, sometimes in packs they come, descending from the stars upon leathery wings. Upon four legs they go, but at times walk upon their hind quarters... In size, akin to a common cow, yet as neither cow, bird, nor insect do they wholly present and are instead a menagerie of all crossed with the foulness of a human corpse.
alternative_names: Servant of He Not To be Named
monster_entry.main_entry_text: This interstellar race is believed to serve Hastur, the Unnamable and may be summoned to partake in rituals. Composed of conventional matter, they are vulnerable to ordinary mundane weapons but possess cunning intelligence and guile. Dwelling in interstellar space, byakhee do not have bases on Earth, but may be summoned to perform deeds or to serve as steeds.

powers_and_abilities.name: Fly
powers_and_abilities.description: Can fly through space and carry a rider; though such riders need protection from the vacuum and cold by suitable spells or potions (e.g. Space-Mead).

attacks.name: Bite and Hold (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Remains attached and drains blood (3D10 STR) until death or victim breaks free (opposed STR roll). Escaping death, victim regains 1D10+5 STR per day.

monster_entry.spells: 40% chance of knowing 1D4 spells (relate to Hastur).

monster_entry.name: Chakota
monster_entry.subtitle: Many-Faced Monstrosity
monster_entry.description: A great mass of screaming, agonized human faces, each protruding from a cylindrical mass of pale, purple-gray flesh some six feet in height or length, and three to four feet in diameter. The loathsome worm-like body is reminiscent of a mass of sickly, purple-veined muscle. The many faces are those victims the chakota has consumed, each mouth ready to bite and consume any who would approach.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: A chakota is composed of the faces of its victims; each weeps, shouts, or cries out with great woe or anger. Somewhat mobile, it moves slowly and cannot climb, and so specimens are usually kept in pits from which they cannot escape, used by cults as a sacrificial "altar" or guardians. A willing person is required to create a chakota, whose body is consumed during a hideous magical ritual, and whose face becomes the first of the newborn creature.

powers_and_abilities.name: Wail
powers_and_abilities.description: Hearing the woeful wail of a chakota for the first time costs 1/1D8 Sanity points. Hearing the wail thereafter costs no Sanity points.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: May bite with up to 1D8 faces per round. A successful bite clamps down on a victim, pulling and holding them. Victim may attempt opposed STR roll to break free (automatic +1 damage per set of clamped teeth when attempting to break free).

armor.modifiers: Immune to physical mundane weapons; fire and electrical based attacks can cause harm; if the mouths are covered, it can suffocate in earth or water.

monster_entry.name: Chaugnar Faugn, Brother of (Lesser)
monster_entry.subtitle: Vampiric Horrors
monster_entry.description: Much like their sire do they appear, lesser in stature yet requisite of skeletal heads on which large, webbed ears sprout, two or more tusks or horns, and tentacle-like trunks, in part reminiscent of a decaying elephant. The trunk member flares outwards at its tip, presenting a disk-like orifice ringed with razor-sharp and hook-like teeth. The tusks appear crystalline in nature.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Chaugnar Faugn's servants appear in two forms: lesser and greater versions. Usually, they guard sacred places or are sent forth to do their master's bidding. A form of permanent psychic bond links Chaugnar Faugn to its children; when that Great Old One is somehow harmed or in distress, its children also appear to suffer in a similar fashion. Their exceptional hearing appears to compensate for relatively poor eyesight.

attacks.name: Bite (Blood Drain)
attacks.special_effect: Latches onto target with trunk, draining blood. Causes 1 damage each round after initial attack. Target may break free with opposed STR or DEX roll.

attacks.name: Crush (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Attempts to envelop target and then crush.

monster_entry.name: Chthonian (Adult)
monster_entry.subtitle: Tentacled Burrowers
monster_entry.description: Immense earth-bound snake-squid-worms, with tough elongated bodies coated with viscous slime. Something like a huge tentacle ending in a twisting and pulsating cluster of smaller tentacles or feelers, each tipped with sharp teeth. Its four eyes, equidistant around its "head," are often hidden from view. They live below ground, burrowing through the earth.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: These powerful burrowers bear little resemblance to anything else on this planet. Rarely seen, these entities live toward the earth's core, with only a few individuals visiting the upper strata and outer crust. Chthonians use telepathy, able to communicate with others of their race anywhere in the world, sense human (and other) minds, and (when a full adult) telepathically control members of other species. They can tunnel through rock as though it were butter.

powers_and_abilities.name: Telepathic Control
powers_and_abilities.description: May use telepathy to control humans and other species to serve their needs. Targeted human falls under sway if the monster wins an opposed POW roll. Target becomes bound to the area.

powers_and_abilities.name: Cause Earthquake
powers_and_abilities.description: Adult chthonians can create earthquakes. Force is figured by totaling the POW of participating chthonians and dividing by 100 to get Richter scale magnitude.

attacks.name: Hold and Drain (Maneuver)
attacks.description: If a tentacle flail strikes home, it clings and worms its way into the victim's vitals, draining blood/fluids (3D10 CON permanent loss each round).

attacks.name: Crush
attacks.description: Rears up and crashes down on a group. Crush area diameter is SIZ/50 in yards. Victims must succeed with DEX, Dodge, or Jump roll.

armor.modifiers: Regenerates 5 hit points per round (death at zero hit points); water in large quantities is harmful (1D6 damage per round).

monster_entry.name: Cold One
monster_entry.subtitle: Ghostly Wailers
monster_entry.description: Heralded by tortured wails upon the wind, the Ylidheem are ghost-like beings, appearing as human-shaped swirling snow and vapor, and manifest in areas of extreme cold. Semi-corporeal, they seep through the smallest of cracks to seek out their prey.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Cold ones seem to only be encountered in regions or seasons of bitter cold, appearing and disappearing into snowy skies or drifts of snow and ice like ghosts. Being only partially immaterial, they cannot pass through solid matter, although may gain entrance through the slimmest of openings. Whether they are a distinct species or the tortured souls of once-human worshippers of the Great Old Ones is disputed.

attacks.name: Freezing Touch
attacks.special_effect: No actual wounds. Inflicts loss of 1D10 CON and 1D2 hit points. For every 15 combined points lost, victim loses 5 APP and 5 STR. Medical attention required to recover.

armor.modifiers: Immune to all physical mundane attacks; fire deals 2D6 damage per successful strike.

monster_entry.sanity_loss: 0/1D6 to encounter; 0/1D3 to hear tortured shriek.

monster_entry.name: Colour Out of Space
monster_entry.subtitle: Life-Force Feeders
monster_entry.description: A shaft of phosphorescence, a strange light from the spaces between the stars... A stream of alien, sentient color, unplaceable as it bears no resemblance to anything in nature. Not gaseous, but insubstantial; when it moves, some say it is visible as an amorphous, glistening patch of colour.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Colours come from an area of space or other dimensions where natural laws differ. Adult colours create sphere-carrying embryos, which are sent out through space to find nourishment on other worlds. The jellylike larva can grow to great size. As it infiltrates and infects the ecosystem, local vegetation exhibits a tremendous but unhealthy growth... After a few months, the larva matures into a young colour and begins to drain the life force from the area.

powers_and_abilities.name: Disintegrate
powers_and_abilities.description: Can focus energies to disintegrate a hole through almost any material. Used primarily to excavate a lair.

powers_and_abilities.name: Solidify
powers_and_abilities.description: Can concentrate and solidify a part of itself to manipulate objects.

powers_and_abilities.name: Mental Attack
powers_and_abilities.description: Can weaken and corrupt minds nearby. Each day, victim must make opposed INT roll or lose 1D6 MP and 1D6 Sanity. Binds victim to the area (requires Hard/Extreme POW roll to leave).

attacks.name: Characteristic Drain
attacks.special_effect: If Colour wins opposed POW, it permanently drains 1D10 points each of STR, CON, POW, DEX, and APP.

armor.modifiers: Physical mundane attacks (incl. bullets) cause no damage; strong magnetic fields can imprison a colour. Vulnerable to bright light.

monster_entry.sanity_loss: 0/1D4 to encounter; 1/1D8 to see a victim.

monster_entry.name: Crawling One
monster_entry.subtitle: Wriggling Masters of Sorcery
monster_entry.description: Composed of thousands of worms, insects, and maggots, each individually alive yet collectively forming a consciousness born from the lasting will of a dead wizard or witch. Twisting and writhing in unison, the mass holds a human-like shape, covered by rags, robes, or other clothing to conceal its terrible aspect.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: In past times, good folk were wise to burn the bodies of evil wizards, lest their "essential fats" be eaten and consumed by grave worms and the like... a crawling one is a union of such crawling creatures, forming a human-like mass, able to disguise itself to pass as human and work its malign intent. The ingested "will" of the wizard effectively drives the mass to work collectively.

powers_and_abilities.name: Discorporate
powers_and_abilities.description: If gravely threatened, can disintegrate at will into a pile of individual insects/worms to escape. Takes 1 round. Can reform in another round.

armor.modifiers: Mundane weapons deal minimal damage (bullets 1 point, shotgun pellets minimum). Fire, electrical, and chemical attacks deal full damage.

monster_entry.spells: Knows at least 1D10 spells, usually including Dominate.

monster_entry.name: Crystallizers of Dreams, Guardian of
monster_entry.subtitle: Dream Creepers
monster_entry.description: These strange entities may be encountered in both the Waking World and the Dreamlands. Appearing as shadowy silhouettes or half-images, they take the form of a nightmare conjured from the mind of those they target... They are featureless except for a pair of yellow eyes that glow menacingly. A sudden, cold chill may herald their presence.
alternative_names: Keepers of the Heart of Dream
monster_entry.main_entry_text: These creatures are somehow linked to artifacts known as Crystallizers of Dreams (sometimes referred to as Hearts of Dream), which are in turn connected to the Elder God commonly referred to as Hypnos. Acting as guardians of the devices, these entities herald from another dimension that exists between the realms of dream and consciousness. Lore states that both use and misuse of a Crystallizer of Dream alerts and brings forth the guardians.

powers_and_abilities.name: Implacable Hunter
powers_and_abilities.description: Considered to always succeed with their CON roll to determine MOV in chases. Ignore mundane obstacles and hazards.

attacks.name: Entangle
attacks.description: Wraps shadowy arms around victim. If entangled for 3 consecutive rounds, the victim is dragged through a portal into the realm of Hypnos on the 4th round. Victim may escape with opposed STR vs POW roll or by using spells like Curse of Darkness or Elder Sign.

armor.modifiers: Immune to mundane physical damage (incl. bullets).

monster_entry.spells: Roll 1D100; if result is <= 1/5 INT, knows that many spells. Can cast Dreamlands spells in the Waking World.

monster_entry.name: Cthulhu, Star-Spawn of
monster_entry.subtitle: Satraps of the Sleeper
monster_entry.description: Gigantic cephalopodic beings, whose heads are a corruption of tentacles set beneath two or more eyes that glow with radiant malice. With humanoid bodies, sometimes with multiple limbs or appendages, they rest until the Old Ones return. Dead yet alive, their dreams seep, corrupting unwitting minds much like their kin and master, Great Cthulhu.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: While star-spawn resemble Great Cthulhu, they are somewhat smaller in stature, yet still gigantic in relation to humanity. Human dreams and visions often depict Cthulhu's spawn as possessing human-like bodies, with two legs and arms; however, star-spawn may be encountered in various forms, from humanoid to protean masses of walking flesh. Despite most being confined or "caged" like their high priest and master in the dead city of Sunken R'lyeh, some are entombed elsewhere.

powers_and_abilities.name: Dream Sending
powers_and_abilities.description: Humans living within the area of an entombed star-spawn may be subject to its psychic residue or dreams. Star-spawn may send forth their mind to seek out and influence susceptible humans.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: May attack with tentacles or claws to crush, rent, or seize, and may use its body to slam and mash.

armor.modifiers: Regenerates 3 hit points per round (death at zero hit points).

monster_entry.spells: Knows 3D6 spells; possibly Contact Cthulhu, Create Mist of R'lyeh, Grasp of Cthulhu, Send Dream.

monster_entry.name: Cthulhu, Thrall of
monster_entry.subtitle: Servants of the Sleeper
monster_entry.description: Bloated, jelly-like gray-blue corpulent masses. Their puffy flesh exudes tiny, jelly-like droplets that smell of methane. They are hairless, with slit-like unblinking yellow-red eyes. Small vestigial tentacles surround a mouth filled with crooked and sharp teeth... Once human, their forms vary but each belies their original heritage.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Humans transformed into monstrous servant creatures, their minds totally consumed by their devotion to Great Cthulhu. After years of worship and a succession of debased rituals, the cultist transforms into something more than human. When a thrall reaches advanced age (50-100 years), it permanently enters the sea to continue its service, usually joining with deep ones or star-spawn.

powers_and_abilities.name: Not Death
powers_and_abilities.description: When reduced to zero hit points by physical damage, turns into a cloud of gray, foul-smelling gas. In 1D8+1 rounds, reforms completely healed. If reduced to zero by magic/spells, dies permanently.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Each thrall's attacks vary slightly depending on transformation (claws, tentacles, multiple mouths).

armor.modifiers: Regenerates 1D6 hit points per round (see Not Death).

monster_entry.spells: Any known as human or gifted by Cthulhu.

monster_entry.name: Dark Crawler
monster_entry.subtitle: Voracious Worms
monster_entry.description: They come up from the ground like horrid worms, thicker than a human thigh and up to 4 yards in length. Along their "backs" can be found pairs of small translucent feelers. Their heads... are bulbous but present a lamprey-like mouth filled with rows of large needles. Around the mouth, are numerous black eyes set within deep pits.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: These nightmarish lamprey-like worms travel from location to location, seeking out minds from which to draw sustenance. Dark crawlers are gifted with psychic powers, most notably a form of telepathy allowing them to communicate with other sentient creatures... They live in a globe-spanning web of caves, traversing far beneath the beds of the oceans.

powers_and_abilities.name: Telepathy
powers_and_abilities.description: Able to mentally communicate with other sentient life forms, imparting or implanting information in the form of bad dreams, hallucinations, and suggestions. May also read minds (target forgets information if they fail a Hard POW roll).

powers_and_abilities.name: Siphon Energy
powers_and_abilities.description: When within 100 yards/meters, may attempt to psychically feast upon a victim's life force (POW). Requires opposed POW roll. If failed (or victim is unconscious), victim loses 1D6 POW per round until stopped.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Can use its body mass to clobber opponents.

armor.modifiers: Suffers half damage from mundane weapon attacks (incl. bullets); regenerates 2 hit points per round (death at zero hit points).

monster_entry.name: Deep One
monster_entry.subtitle: Masters of the Deep
monster_entry.description: Humanoid fish-frog people... their scaled, sometimes rugose, skin is a grayish-green to blue... Shiny and slippery, with fin-like ridges on their backs, and webbed feet and hands. Their heads vary in disposition, appearing fish- or frog-like, with prodigious bulging eyes and wide, thin-lipped mouths possessing shark-like teeth.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Deep ones are an amphibious race that primarily serves Cthulhu and two beings known as Father Dagon and Mother Hydra. Locked in the timeless depths of the sea, their alien and arrogant lives are coldly beautiful, unbelievably cruel, and effectively immortal. They are a marine race, unknown in freshwater environments, and globally have many cities, all submerged beneath the waves.

powers_and_abilities.name: Breathe Underwater
powers_and_abilities.description: Require no exterior help to breathe underwater and are equally capable of breathing on land.

monster_entry.spells: 40% chance of knowing 1D4 spells (poss. Contact Father Dagon, Contact Mother Hydra, Contact Star-spawn of Cthulhu, Grasp of Cthulhu, Summon Deep Ones, Wave of Oblivion).

monster_entry.name: Deep One Hybrid
monster_entry.subtitle: Strange Progeny
monster_entry.description: Thin humans, stoop-shouldered, with watery eyes that never seem to blink. Their whole demeanor seemed wrong, and they lurched or shambled forward as if on unsteady legs. Some had facial deformities: receding chins or foreheads, half-realized noses or ears... close examination of the strange creases on their necks would reveal vestigial gill slits.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Deep one hybrids are, in the main, the progeny of deep one and human mating. Although the offspring of such unions are usually born as normal humans, changes in appearance and physiology tend to occur in late teens commonly known as the "Innsmouth Look." ...By middle age, most hybrids display some form of gross deformity... Within a few years, the hybrid undergoes the final transformation into a full deep one.

powers_and_abilities.name: Breath Underwater (Partial)
powers_and_abilities.description: Unable to breathe underwater until full transformation, but can remain underwater for up to twice as long as the average human.

monster_entry.spells: Older hybrids who have embraced their heritage have a 10% chance of knowing 1D3 spells.

monster_entry.name: Desh
monster_entry.subtitle: Things from Outside
monster_entry.description: From without they come, penetrating the curtain of our realm to cavort and feast. The smaller ones have a slivery skin upon their fat, little ovoid bodies... Their larger, more fearsome kin are long limbed and slender, with wide mouths containing lines of curved six-inch teeth.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Named the desh by the Hyperboreans, these creatures originate in another dimension, yet find it easy to slip through dimensional walls to "swim" in our reality, most often using the energy and power within a human brain as a mechanism to travel into this world. In our world, they are invisible and semi-material. They come in two distinct groups: the lesser and the greater desh.

attacks.name: Ensnare (Lesser Maneuver)
attacks.description: Use nails and limbs to wrap around a target, causing them to fall over (1D4 to 1D6 damage).

attacks.name: Grab (Greater Maneuver)
attacks.description: Attempts to grab a target and then, on the following round, bite down on the victim's flesh.

armor.modifiers: If successfully hitting a greater desh, multiply the damage rolled by five; the result is the percentage chance of killing it outright. If this roll fails, the attack causes no damage.

monster_entry.name: Devil Creeper
monster_entry.subtitle: Blood-Soaked Vines of Death
monster_entry.description: Maturing rapidly, the growth eventually sprouts from the host's body, violently ripping through skin and bone in a shower of blood and gore. The dead host's remains continue to fertilize the deadly plant-like entity... In visage, the plant is nothing less than a writhing mass of vines that end in a variety of maws and strange orb-like eyes.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: These evil seeds have been used by wizards and others of ill-intent as guards and as a form of retribution. As seeds, devil creepers are inert and only begin to develop when consumed by a living creature (human or animal). Within 2D6 days, the seed grows inside the host body and then sprouts forth, destroying the host. Once mature, the devil creeper tends to remain in the same spot unless summoned.

attacks.name: Grab (Maneuver)
attacks.description: One vine wraps around target. Each additional success adds another vine. Once held, target may be strangled, squeezed, or bitten (automatic 1D6 damage per turn).

armor.modifiers: Non-impaling weapons and bullets deal minimum damage; slashing weapons deal normal damage; resistant to fire and electricity; toxic chemicals deal 1D6 per round.

monster_entry.name: Dhole
monster_entry.subtitle: Planet Eaters
monster_entry.description: A cancerous infliction upon the planets they consume, gigantic worms reaching over 600 feet in length and 20 feet thick, and some even larger... Their skin is armor-clad with thick chitinous-like sections through which no sword could pass. At one end is the feasting mouth, hidden beneath a segmented aperture.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Dholes are gigantic worm-like burrowing horrors. They are not native to the Earth and none seem to have been brought here for more than brief periods. They seem to have riddled and laid waste to other worlds, consuming them from within. They are rarely seen in daylight, as they dislike direct light, though it does not visibly harm them.

attacks.name: Engulf
attacks.description: Scoops clean an area equal to the size of its goo attack. Keeper determines survival chances.

attacks.name: Spit Goo
attacks.description: Spits a gob of slime up to 2-3 miles. Goo covers diameter equal to 1% of SIZ in feet (approx 27 ft). Target is engulfed, stunned, and begins to drown.

monster_entry.name: Dimensional Shambler
monster_entry.subtitle: Dimension-Hoppers
monster_entry.description: Hulking extra-dimensional entities, seemingly outlandish combinations of crustacean, insect, and ape-like mammal. In places, their hide is like thick plates of armor, while elsewhere their skin is loose and rugose. Black points of light appear to be eyes set deep into a rudimentary head... Large talon-like clawed appendages protrude from the arms.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Little is known about these beings who seem capable of walking between the planes and worlds of the cosmos, never spending much time at any one location. It is unknown whether they are a distinct interdimensional species or constructs created in the deep passages of time to serve a higher power. Rumors suggest that these entities occasionally serve the Outer Gods and Great Old Ones.

powers_and_abilities.name: Trans-dimensional Travel
powers_and_abilities.description: Able to leave a plane of existence or translocate at will. Costs 4 MP and takes 1 round (cannot fight back/dodge during transit). Can take objects/beings by clutching them and spending +1 MP per 50 SIZ of the object/creature.

attacks.name: Grab (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Attempts to latch onto a target. If successful, on the following round, it may instantly transport to anywhere in this plane or another dimension. Victim may attempt to break free on their action (opposed STR/DEX).

monster_entry.name: Dweller in the Depths
monster_entry.subtitle: Aquatic Horrors
monster_entry.description: From an elliptical body extended eight appendages, arm-like and ending in something akin to a flipper, although two were more like writhing tentacles. It appeared to use the flippers for locomotion, able to "walk" on land just as easily as swimming through water. There was no head as such, rather a gross nodule on which a round, sponge-like organ sprouted... The damnable appearance was made worse due to the creature's transparent skin, through which one could discern bizarre internal organs and a spherical yet misshaped brain.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Said to be associated with entities like Great Cthulhu, Dagon and Hydra, and the cursed star-spawn, these creatures appear to be amphibious, with some suggesting they are a larger, more powerful, and advanced strain of deep ones. Inhabiting places beneath the ocean as well as certain great freshwater lakes. The Cult of Cthulhu holds the dwellers in great regard.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Uses two tentacle arms to swipe and bash, and tentacle legs to kick.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.special_effect: Mouth tentacles latch onto flesh, pulling victim into mouth where coarse tentacles rake and tear.

armor.modifiers: Immune to most physical damage. Exception: if 5+ damage is dealt to the brain-organ (penalty die to target), it instantly dies. Fire and electrical attacks inflict normal damage.

monster_entry.spells: 2D6 spells relating to Cthulhu, deep ones, and aquatic horrors.

monster_entry.name: Eihort, Broodling of
monster_entry.subtitle: Gestalt Servants
monster_entry.description: The pale man... his body dissolving and liquifying. Strange white foam poured from his mouth, eyes, and ears, and then from the flesh as it lost its elasticity and corrupted. Soon, what was once human, became soggy mounds of writhing white jelly-like spiders.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Broodlings are gestalt beings made up of millions of the tiny white spidery brood of Eihort. When combined, a broodling looks like a deathly pale, hairless human of average size. In such a form, the entity is capable of a guttural speech. It is not until a broodling suffers physical damage that its true nature becomes apparent... each point of damage causes bits of a broodling to come apart, falling off as globby masses of the white spidery brood.

powers_and_abilities.name: Spider Form
powers_and_abilities.description: If reduced to zero HP, melts into millions of spiders. A group of 20+ may attack (30%, 1 damage). Unconscious victims may have spiders crawl inside them (1D4 damage/day).

armor.modifiers: Mundane attacks deal minimum damage; if it escapes with even 1 HP, fully regenerates in 10 mins/HP. Death at 0 HP (melts into spiders).

monster_entry.sanity_loss: No loss for human form; 1/1D8 to see true nature/melting.

monster_entry.name: Elder Thing
monster_entry.subtitle: Mysterious Scientists
monster_entry.description: Gray colored, barrel-shaped beings, six to eight feet in length... The central mass displays five vertical ridges, between which are strange growths from which wing-like membranes can unfold... The apex of the body mass tapers to a bulbous neck from which a five-pointed starfish-like "head" rises... Overall, despite seemingly changeable color orientation, the skin appears leathery and tough.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Elder things came to Earth a billion years ago and may have accidentally started terrestrial life through arcane experimentation. Foremost scientists, they created the blasphemous shoggoths to serve as slaves, building vast cities around the globe. By the time humanity was evolving, the elder things were already degenerating as a race... While only the dead or those in frozen hibernation can be found in the frozen remains of their Antarctic city, there remain living communities of elder things in the deepest and darkest parts of the ocean.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Due to the alignment of its five eyes and tentacles, it can attack and defend in a 360-degree arc (surprise attacks suffer penalty dice).

attacks.name: Seize (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Once a tentacle grips, it clings to the target and inflicts crushing damage. Can hold up to five victims (one per tentacle).

monster_entry.name: Fire Vampire
monster_entry.subtitle: Burning Stars
monster_entry.description: It was though the stars were falling... Many came in flaming clusters, exploding outward into hundreds or thousands of individual star-like flames, each no larger than a candle flame. These living star-flames danced in the air in a mesmerizing fashion. Whatever they touched burst into flame.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Fire vampires are said to be minions of the Great Old One Cthugha and, like that entity, dwell on or in the planetary system of the star Fomalhaut. Extraterrestrial, fire vampires appear to be intelligent gas or plasma... unable to move through water, which can kill them.

powers_and_abilities.name: Mesmerizing Dance
powers_and_abilities.description: The crazed dance of multiple fire vampires can produce a hypnotic effect. Target must succeed with a POW roll or fall under a trance (unable to move, unaware of being set on fire).

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Target makes CON roll to halve damage. Then opposed POW roll: if vampire wins, it steals 1D10 MP; if target wins, vampire loses 1 MP. Flammable targets catch fire (burn damage doubles each round).

attacks.name: Cluster
attacks.special_effect: Target makes CON roll to halve damage. Cannot steal MP in cluster form.

armor.modifiers: Mundane weapons (incl. bullets) deal no damage. Water deals 1 damage per half-gallon (2 ltr).

monster_entry.name: Fisher from Outside
monster_entry.subtitle: Servants of Groth-golka
monster_entry.description: Great and dark avian creatures with leprous veined flesh instead of feathers and membranous wings... Immense things, caricatures of earthly birds, which hop about on a single-foot when not in flight, while above a hooked and fang-lined beak, glows an all-seeing Cyclopean eye.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Sometimes confused with shantaks and even prehistoric Pterosaurs, the fishers from outside are a distinct species believed to serve the Great Old One known as Groth-golka. Called down from the spaces between and beyond the stars, the fishers sometimes act as proxies, accepting and devouring human sacrifices while also metering out the divine will of their master.

powers_and_abilities.name: Foul Imagery
powers_and_abilities.description: Seeing or touching a representation of a fisher requires a Hard POW roll. Failure causes nightmares (1 Sanity loss per night) or brooding introspection (oblivious to surroundings).

attacks.name: Grasp (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Swoops down to grasp target. On following rounds, crushes life out of victim. Victim may fall if released (1D6 to 4D6 damage).
